docs.snippet: People think the Russian president is a hard-nosed realist. But the danger is that he’s nothing of the kind....

docs.snippet: For Blackhawks left wing Artemi Panarin, a Russian, the language of hockey takes over at the rink, and he has responded by becoming one of the top first-year players in the N.H.L....
docs.lead_paragraph: For Blackhawks left wing Artemi Panarin, a Russian, the language of hockey takes over at the rink, and he has responded by becoming one of the top first-year players in the N.H.L.
docs.abstract: Artemi Panarin, rookie Russian left wing for Chicago Blackhawks, has difficulty communicating with English-language media, but it has not affected his play as he emerges as top candidate for annual Calder Memorial Trophy; has also been learning from his teammate, league's top scorer Patrick Kane, with whom he has bonded with on and off ice.

headline.main: Rookie’s English Needs Work, but His Game Is Thriving
headline.print_headline: Rookie’s English Needs Work, but His Game Is Thriving

docs.snippet: The report, to be released Thursday as the second installment from a commission investigating doping allegations, is expected to focus on officials accused of blackmailing athletes....
docs.lead_paragraph: The report, to be released Thursday as the second installment from a commission investigating doping allegations, is expected to focus on officials accused of blackmailing athletes.
docs.abstract: Upcoming report by commission appointed by World Anti-Doping Agency is expected to detail widespread corruption among top international track and field officials; previous installment of report focused on Russia and resulted in its suspension from international competition.

headline.main: Report Is Expected to Detail Corruption in World Track and Field
headline.print_headline: Report Is Expected to Detail the Corruption of Top Officials

docs.snippet: The Russian president told a German newspaper it was premature to discuss Mr. Assad’s future but not impossible the dictator would relocate to Russia....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Russian president told a German newspaper it was premature to discuss Mr. Assad’s future but not impossible the dictator would relocate to Russia.
docs.abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin hints that his country could grant asylum to Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Putin Doesn’t Rule Out Asylum in Moscow for Syria’s Assad
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Russia: Option for a Syrian’s Exit

docs.snippet: According to the latest United Nations estimates, 244 million people, or 3.3 percent of the world’s population, live in a country other than the one where they were born....
docs.lead_paragraph: According to the latest United Nations estimates, 244 million people, or 3.3 percent of the world’s population, live in a country other than the one where they were born.
docs.abstract: United Nations estimates that 3.3 percent of world's population no longer live in their native country; United States was by far most popular destination for migrants in 2015.

headline.main: Millions Leave Native Lands, With Broad Repercussions
headline.print_headline: Millions Leave Native Lands, With Broad Repercussions

docs.snippet: Amid increasing concerns about instability in Afghanistan pouring over into the former Soviet republics and Russia, the Russian foreign ministry says it plans to supply small arms to Kabul though it will refrain from sending other weapons....
